Can he not feel (tho' darker is his hue</br>Than that of white man,) as the white man feels?</br>Can he not love, and love with fervor too,</br>And taste a joy when infant prank reveals</br>A growing mind? — and when his prattler kneels,</br>With half form'd syllables, the One on high</br>Praises; a thrill of rapture steals,</br>And sparkles brightly in the parent's eye,</br>Who reads in young devotion future purity.

Then if he feels as you feel — has a heart</br>As prone as yours to ev'ry tie that binds</br>Man to his fellow — why inflict the smart</br>Of direst scourgings — servitude which grinds</br>The very soul of him who early finds</br>He has a frame as tender as your own?</br>Ah!  often, often, his sad fate reminds</br>The ill used negro of his wife — alone—</br>Who has of soothers for her loss, alas! — not one.

If he offend ye, sin against the law,</br>Is he not punish'd with unfeeling ire?</br>And from his back the ruby drops ye draw,</br>And future watchfulness from him require.</br>And why not then, admit him to the high'r</br>Concerns of life, where he deserves to be?</br>Oh!  I could ever tune compassion's lyre,</br>And paint his woes and unmeet misery,</br>If I could get one slave from noble freemen, free.

Shame on ye, boasted freemen — who pretend</br>The laws of God and Nature to obey;</br>Who swear to Virtue you will ever lend</br>Your whole protection — bow beneath the sway</br>Of truth and principle — the only ray</br>To light men — freemen on — no, ye are bound</br>By your own love of gold — ye still betray</br>The hapless negro — still is heard the sound</br>Of the poor Afric's woes, far echoing around.

If ye would wish to brighten up your fame,</br>Which now is sinking 'neath derision's blast,</br>And then appear with an unsullied name,</br>That none could scandal, satire on it cast,</br>But all exclaim at, honour the contrast;</br>Proclaim him free! — yea, let the Negro rove</br>Untrammel'd and unchained — your nation vast,</br>Will to the world, then honourably prove,</br>That freedom ye uphold, her ev'ry accent, love.</br>
